video_description:
The Barnes & Noble Nook Tablet is an update to last year's Nook Color, and a direct competitor to the Amazon Kindle Fire. L.A. Times Technology blogger Nathan Olivarez-Giles offers his take.

For Nathan's full review, check out the Times Technology blog at...

http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/technology/2011/11/barnes-noble-nook-tablet-review-video.html

Video produced by Armand Emamdjomeh/Los Angeles Times
title: Barnes & Noble Nook Tablet Video Review

comments.text:
Another typical, outstanding, review x laTimesGuy!﻿ This guy is always thinking.

Answer to the "loop", "hook", "key  chain" on one corner of the Nook:  in engineering we'd call it an "orientation loop"... it allows you to reach into your pocket, shoulder pack, purse, whatever and pull the Nook out and "know" what side is "up" to power the device up.
comments.author: raftjm

comments.text: Not true you said that 15 gig goes to barnes and 1 goes to amazon or itones, Barnes tablet﻿ doesnt have Amazon.

comments.text:
My bf got me a Kindle Fire for my birthday and I love it.  It's lightweight and easy to use straight out of the box.  The first thing I recommend anyone with a new Kindle do is install the nook app.  We got our instructions from kindlemad  through google.   

It basically unlocks all the Android marketplace apps and unlocks the device.  Super﻿ happy!

comments.text: Just root this thing, even though﻿ it has a locked bootloader you can at least probably free up those 15gb in the near future if you get the tablet (plus the expandable memory makes it infinitely more valuable than the kindle fire as you can also side load those amazon services if you want).

comments.author: audioa4vr

comments.text: Barnes & Noble Tablet has no relations to Amazon whatsoever.  This tablet comes with 16gb and can be extended via a micro sd card, which you can purchase at Best Buy. All books, magazines, newspapers that you purchase are connected to a BN account.  Music, videos, or other files you add on can be saved on a﻿ micro sd. I work for BN, I know what I'm talking about.
